intro: Psychotria cordata, commonly known as the "Coca plant," is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical leaves and small, white flowers. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that contain the alkaloid cocaine. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to its alkaloidal content, it has significant botanical and pharmacological interest.
